fields.name: Ethiopia Chelichele
fields.description:
Origin: Ethiopia Chelichele

Region: Yirgacheffe

Farm/Co-op: Worka Chelichele Washing Station

SCA Grade: 88

Processing: Anaerobic Natural 

Altitude: 1945-1970m (above sea level)

Varietal: JARC varieties, local landraces

Harvest: October – January

fields.name: Honduras Pedro Joel Fiallos
fields.description:
Origin: Honduras Pedro Joel Fiallos

Region: Los Limos, Corquin Copan

Farm / Co-op: San Rafael

Processing: Natural

SCA Score: 87

Altitude: 1250m

Varietal: Parainema

fields.name: Costa Rican Tarrazu
fields.description:
Our Costa Rican Tarrazu coffee possesses an inherently intense flavor with peaks of bright acidity and depths of sweet honey and chocolate. The body of Costa Rican Tarrazu is considered medium, but this famous coffee region does not lack for flavor and in all produces an incredibly satisfying cup.

In a spectacular region of Costa Rica known as the "Land of the Saints", farmers work tirelessly to care for this beautiful Costa Rican Tarrazu coffee. The main suppliers of this Costa Rican coffee represent small micro mills and traditional coops, ensuring only the highest quality cherries are obtained for production of this authentic Tarrazu coffee.

During the growth, harvest and processing of these coffee beans, all coffee pickers and producers are supplied with insurance, medical services, housing and transportation to the farming facilities.

fields.name: El Edén Decaf
fields.description:
Our Current decaf offering is a Swiss water process coffee from Colombia. This chemical free process to remove decaf is considered the best way to keep as many possible desirable flavours while removing the caffeine.

This coffee comes from Quindio, Colombia. Quindio sits within the Paisa region, an area famous for coffee production with a high concentration of producers. El Eden itself is situated in a privileged position amongst the Cordillera Central, one of three veins of the Andes as they run through the country north to south.

fields.name: Rocked Roast Robusta
fields.description: Our Rocket Roast coffee beans are single origin, Vietnamese, dark roasted robusta coffee beans. The beans result in an earthy aromatic brew, with dark chocolate undertones and soft cranberry notes. All complemented by the high levels of caffeine naturally contained in robusta coffee beans. Robusta coffee beans are a strong cofffee bean, perfect if you need a bit more go in those early mornings. Our Rocket Roast balances the extra caffeine, ensuring your cup is neither too bitter nor acidic. All our coffees are freshly roasted, and our Rocket Roast is available in wholebean to ensure the you get the freshest possible robusta coffee beans delivered to your door possible.

fields.name: KENYA KAGUMO
fields.description:
Kagumo Factory is a wet mill in the Kirinyaga County associated with the Mutira Farmers Cooperative Society.  The Mutira FCS has approximately 4,000 members with about 477 hectares of land dedicated to coffee cultivation.  Kagumo is one of many factories in the area to which the members of Mutira deliver their coffee.

Flavor Notes:  Grapefruit, Florals, Complex

fields.name: COLOMBIA EL CARMEN
fields.description:
PROCESS
Washed

PRODUCERS
Approximately 300 families

GROWN
Pitalito, Huila

ALTITUDE
1450m - 2150m

VARIETALS
Caturra, Typica, Colombia, Castillo

Part of the Red Association Pitalito Group. This coffee is grown on about 660 hectares of land represented by 300 families based in Pitalito who were looking to improve their annual income and quality of their coffee. Through work with our partners Raw Materials and Invercafe, who have handled the drying and finance for the farmers, we are working to provide them with a sustainable supply chain and access to the speciality coffee market. (NB- be careful not to spell as 'Columbia' when writing to a native Colombian, they do not appreciate it!)

fields.name: SETAMO ETHIOPIA
fields.description:
A beautiful example of a washed Ethiopia coffee. This lot comes from Setamo, a co-operative in the Sidama region with 1800 smallholder farmer members. The area has perfect conditions: fertile soil, optimum rainfall and sits at around 1800 m.a.s.l.  

These high elevations also mean that the coffee tends to ripen slower, with a later harvest season than the rest of Ethiopia. This allows the cherries to develop complex flavours and aromas – a distinctive characteristic of Sidama coffee. Discover this region for yourself with Setamo coffee…

fields.name: Pura Vida Oscura
fields.description:
Pura Vida Oscura - for those who love the classics, but do not like bitterness. Refined, full-bodied, full-bodied and sweet espresso.
We still hear echoes of inspiration and energy from Costa Rica! This time they find their expression in a darker, but no less elegant blend of Arabica - Pura Vida Oscura. The cast is simply stellar! Costa Rica Three Sisters is a variety that our customers have already fallen in love with. Sweet, delicate, with an unusual texture for local coffee. Let's add to it the Costa Rica Xalapa Estate - a complex lot collected on a highland plantation with an interesting terroir. We will polish with high-quality Ethiopia. As a result, we get an amazing espresso blend for lovers of the classics. Rich, full-bodied, sweet, but without the bitterness of a dark roast
Dark coffee can be sweet too. Check it out by trying Pura Vida Oscura!

Ingredients: A mixture of three Arabicas - Costa Rica Three sisters, Costa Rica Xalapa, Ethiopia

fields.name: Barselona
fields.description: Barcelona is a balanced blend of three Arabicas. The taste is rich, dense, with moderate bitterness and sourness.
